channel.title: Need help in repeating

item.title: Need help in repeating
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

LMFAO…dude…no, just no.

Every time you run “abcd()”, you are calling 10 new “process()”'s. And every time you call a “process()”, you are calling another “abcd()”. Ever heard of an exponential curve? Much like this, its going to keep getting bigger and bigger over a shorter amount of time until it explodes, which it does when you get that error.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help in repeating
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

lol @ 2nd post…a new compiler: lol. i think you’re trying to get it to show what time it is?..if so try a date and time method
a few strings

String year = 07;
String month = 11;
String day = 13;
String date = year+month+day;

then in the println have

"+date

idk, just a quick thought

item.title: Need help in repeating
item.dc:creator: @r.v.d.p r.v.d.p
item.description:
@r.v.d.p wrote:

hello

Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

this is my script:

public class Robert
{
public static int oo = 0;
public static void main (String[] args)
{
process();
}

public static void process(){
if(oo<=20){
abcd();
System.out.println(oo);
}
}

public static void abcd(){
for (int i = 0; i <= 10; i++);
{
oo++;
process();
}
}
}

a litle bit of help?

Read full topic
